title: Erica Bougard
text:
Erica Marsha Bougard (born July 26, 1993) is an American <a href="heptathlete">heptathlete</a>. She was <a href="NCAA%20Women%27s%20Division%20I%20Indoor%20Track%20and%20Field%20Championships">NCAA indoor champion</a> in 2013 and represented the United States at the <a href="2013%20World%20Championships%20in%20Athletics">2013 World Championships</a>.
Biography.
Erica Bougard was born in <a href="Memphis%2C%20Tennessee">Memphis, Tennessee</a>, but grew up in <a href="Byhalia%2C%20Mississippi">Byhalia, Mississippi</a>. Her first sport was <a href="basketball">basketball</a>; she took up track and field at Byhalia High School. Erica Bougard won 2011 <a href="Mississippi%20High%20School%20Activities%20Association">Mississippi High School Activities Association</a> state outdoor track and field long jump title. Erica was the 2011 Mississippi state long jump leader.
Erica went to <a href="Mississippi%20State%20University">Mississippi State University</a> on a track <a href="Athletic%20scholarship">scholarship</a>.
She won the heptathlon at the 2012 United States Junior Championships, scoring 5547 points; she trailed <a href="Kendell%20Williams">Kendell Williams</a> through six events, but overtook her in the <a href="800%20meters">800 meters</a>. She made her international debut at the <a href="2012%20World%20Junior%20Championships%20in%20Athletics">2012 World Junior Championships</a> in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, placing 13th. In the heptathlon, Bougard is strong in the five running and jumping events, but weak in the <a href="shot%20put">shot put</a> and <a href="javelin%20throw">javelin throw</a>.
As a <a href="sophomore">sophomore</a>, Bougard won the <a href="women%27s%20pentathlon">pentathlon</a> at the 2013 NCAA indoor championships, scoring a school record 4399 points. At the <a href="2013%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20Outdoor%20Track%20and%20Field%20Championships">outdoor NCAA meet</a> she placed fourth in the heptathlon (with a personal best 5976 points) and sixteenth in the long jump. Two weeks later, she improved to 5990 points at the <a href="2013%20USA%20Outdoor%20Track%20and%20Field%20Championships">2013 USA Outdoor Track and Field Championships</a>, placing third and qualifying for the senior <a href="2013%20World%20Championships%20in%20Athletics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20heptathlon">World Championships</a> in <a href="Moscow">Moscow</a>. Bougard scored 5829 points at the World Championships, placing 24th.
At the <a href="2014%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20Indoor%20Track%20and%20Field%20Championships">2014 NCAA indoor championships</a> Bougard was second to Williams with 4586 points; both Williams and Bougard broke the previous <a href="List%20of%20United%20States%20collegiate%20records%20in%20track%20and%20field">collegiate record</a> of 4569 points by <a href="Makeba%20Alcide">Makeba Alcide</a>. Outdoors, Bougard <a href="Redshirt%20%28college%20sports%29">redshirted</a> the collegiate season but broke 6000 points for the first time at the United States championships, repeating her third place from the previous year with 6118 points.
In 2015 Bougard again placed second to Williams at the <a href="2015%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20Indoor%20Track%20and%20Field%20Championships">NCAA indoor meet</a>, this time with 4566 points; outdoors, she scored a personal best 6250 points at the <a href="Southeastern%20Conference">SEC</a> championships and entered the <a href="2015%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20Outdoor%20Track%20and%20Field%20Championships">NCAA outdoor championships</a> as the collegiate leader, but only placed fourth as <a href="Akela%20Jones">Akela Jones</a> won. At the <a href="2015%20USA%20Outdoor%20Track%20and%20Field%20Championships">2015 USATF championships</a> Bougard placed third for the third consecutive year, improving her best to 6288 points and qualifying for the <a href="2015%20World%20Championships%20in%20Athletics">World Championships</a> in <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a>.
In 2016, Bougard completed in three events at <a href="2016%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20Outdoor%20Track%20and%20Field%20Championships">2016 NCAA Division I Outdoor Track and Field Championships</a> in in long jump to place 12th, in high jump to place 5th and 6088 points in heptathlon to place 2nd. Three weeks later, Bougard placed seventh in <a href="heptathlon">heptathlon</a> scoring 6070 points at <a href="2016%20United%20States%20Olympic%20Trials%20%28track%20and%20field%29%23Women%20field%20events">2016 United States Olympic Trials (track and field)</a>. She is openly lesbian.
